name: Flexor Digitorum Profundus Tendon Entrapment
chief_complaint: I can't straighten my ring finger, and it's painful when I try to move it
symptoms: Pain in the palm when bending fingers
Catching or locking sensation in the affected finger
physical_findings: Tenderness over the A2 pulley region
Passive flexion greater than active flexion of the affected digit
Palpable nodule along the flexor tendon sheath
treatment: Corticosteroid injection into the tendon sheath
Surgical release of the A2 pulley if conservative measures fail
prognosis: Good with early intervention, may develop permanent stiffness if left untreated
description: A condition where the flexor digitorum profundus tendon becomes entrapped at the A2 pulley, often due to repetitive gripping activities or acute trauma. This leads to painful triggering and limited finger extension.
risk_factors: Repetitive hand use (e.g., rock climbing, weight lifting)
